comment.body:
I think new site owners should not worry about not getting peers. Just submit the site to these resources (after you built the site and it looks ok):
http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dt7FR5aNLkqAjmosWh8cMWzJu633GYN6u/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n

I think you should get peers quite quickly. Also good to be able to have computer online a few hours after make the site public.
@nekololi , You think Tor mode is not reliable for seeding because it has some bug that will prevent connecting seeder with peer? If so, can it be identified and fixed by Tor?
Hello, the installation step "4." looks like to be for Linux. Is possible to mention in tutorial on how to do that step on Windows?

Hi, mentioned site with banners sometimes does not load for me, so [here is a mirror](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1DJEfWgdJ3rGnqCrKwLrBdQGodRaEBkAry:zeronet:c748ba9a-0c13-4f74-a83a-588641b475e2).

There are already extensions for ipfs and dat:
https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/search/?q=dat%3A%2F%2F&type=extension
https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/search/?q=ipfs%3A%2F%2F&type=extension
FF extension does not obviously include whole implementation of the P2P system. So one have to manualy install and run the appropriate P2P application before trying to visit dat:// or ipfs:// site. For dat://, one can also use [Beaker browser](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1533160269_1JHx7fetxzMnUyQ5bUpNLAKAW9VEZdbFMa).
I am blocking some known tracking networks using uBlock origin browser extension and and some known CDN using https://decentraleyes.org/test/
